summary: the recent pandemic of swineorigin H1N1 2009 influenza A (H1N1/2009) virus 1, 2 and outbreaks of human cases of H5N1 highly pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) 3 have prompted the development of diagnosis methods. rapid diagnostic kits (RDKs) based on immunochromatography utilizing antibodies against nucleoprotein (NP) of influenza virus are used to diagnose influenza. mAbs recognized residues identified as signature amino acids in each NP. these results indicated that hostspecific amino acids of NP could discriminate influenza A viruses from different origin. mAb 3G2 was prepared by immunization of GANP MiceTM.
